title: GM to invest $100 million to upgrade facilities to build self-driving cars
text: March 15, 2018 / 3:44 PM / Updated 25 minutes ago GM to invest $100 million to upgrade facilities to build self-driving cars   WASHINGTON (Reuters) - General Motors Co said Thursday it will invest more than $100 million in two facilities as it prepares to build production versions of its Cruise self-driving car next year at its Orion Township assembly plant in Michigan. The GM logo is seen at the General Motors Warren Transmission Operations Plant in Warren, Michigan October 26, 2015. REUTERS/Rebecca Cook/Files The largest U.S. automaker also said roof modules for GM’s self-driving vehicles will be assembled at its Brownstown Battery Assembly plant. In January, GM filed a petition seeking U.S. government approval for a fully autonomous car - one without a steering wheel, brake pedal or accelerator pedal - to enter the automaker’s first commercial ride-sharing fleet in 2019. Reporting by David Shepardson; Editing by Nick Zieminski
